# Break It

[Link to room](https://tryhackme.com/room/breakit)

## Tools:
1. [CyberChef](https://gchq.github.io/CyberChef/)
2. [Vigenere Decoder](https://www.dcode.fr/vigenere-cipher)
3. [Base91 Decoder](https://www.dcode.fr/base-91-encoding)
4. [Hex Workshop](http://www.hexworkshop.com/)

## Task 1: Bases
This challenge requires the basic knowledge of base decoding/encoding.
### 1. `[Super easy] MVQXG6K7MJQXGZJTGI======`

Using CyberChef, we can immediately get the answer. Just click on the magic wand. 

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/27d483f0-036e-4f7a-a147-5d78d8c14dbd)

### 2. `[Easy] TVJYWEtZVE1NVlBXRVlMVE1WWlE9PT09`

Using CyberChef, we can immediately get the answer as well. Just click on the magic wand.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/a4211e5d-91b0-46ee-bd86-5476c9da4b74)

### 3. `[Moderate] GM4HOU3VHBAW6OKNJJFW6SS2IZ3VAMTYORFDMUC2G44EQULIJI3WIVRUMNCWI6KGK5XEKZDTN5YU2RT2MR3E45KKI5TXSOJTKZJTC4KRKFDWKZTZOF3TORJTGZTXGNKCOE======`

Using CyberChef again, we can get the answer. Just have to click on the magic wand a few times.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/103c9a75-39ea-4390-8b21-327752b0f119)

### 4. `[Hard] HRBUGQDUHFWDIXKUIBWXIJTHIE3DCY3BIE2FKQSZHNDE6MRUIA2TWWDMHRBV2ZKCHQWFCTLPIE2EEJDBIBZCEW3OHUSTOLRCHNFGMVC6IFJXIQ2AHVMVONSBHVOVIM2MHVPV42J4HQVCQ4REIFHVIJ2WHFWDYQSUHROGILJCIFIU23CXHNCEIXK2HRDVSXKOHV2SQJLC`

Using CyberChef again, we can get the answer. This time has to click on the magic wand even more times than the previous one. 

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/0e9d3900-70f8-4d01-9337-5051809d9020)

### 5. `[Insane] `

Using CyberChef, we can see that it is possible to decode using `Base32` and `Base85`.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/199f08cc-e844-4c87-a2d2-3b76d85aaf45)

Initially, I was stuck here. After checking the hint which says "The shorter the better", I decided to try and decode it using decimal (base10), followed by hexadecimal (base16).

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/8e389f46-af78-4dda-813e-e0bbeb50cd51)

Note that we can click on the magic wand here, but it will just show us the same result. The next step from here is to decode it using base91. Hence, copy the long string and paste it into the Base91 Decoder.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/9d99267f-7239-4b2f-8876-82941a4623e1)

Great, we got a shorter string. Let's copy and paste it into the CyberChef and keep clicking the magic wand.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/7cfaef0b-13b9-48d6-8d48-8532c3a56967)

Finally, we got the decoded string.

## Task 2: Base and Cipher
How about mixing both base and cipher?

### 1. `[Easy] PJXHQ4S7GEZV6ZTDOZQQ====`

As usual, paste it into the CyberChef and click on the magic wand.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/ecfa8c49-1322-4862-ab2a-271bf2929f0c)

The output is still encrypted. The title of this task suggests that we need to combine both base and cipher. Hence, let's try to use the rotation cipher. Select `ROT13` as the recipe.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/7af93b9f-22f7-492c-87bd-58d5dac71742)

And there we have our decrypted string.

### 2. `[Moderate] NjZMKVhATl1EcEI2Jio4Q0xuVy1EZSo5ZkFLV0M6QVUtPFpGQ0InIkReYg==` 

As usual, let CyberChef do the work. 

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/051cc0a8-e9ef-4b2b-a1d9-2fc0b170ef54)

We get a partially decrypted message. Notice that it mentioned `key`. Hence, let's try decrypting it using the Vigenere Decoder.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/bf231337-4ed9-497c-9cc8-a05d45f30b72)

And there we got our decrypted string.

### 3. `[Hard] -!r/X,]n/Z-Zs\X,X$,rI<@]#-9Oh,-=A]R-p9\+`

Again, throwing it into the CyberChef will return us a partially decrypted message.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/cb020e1a-c385-4e29-b713-8ded6f17b5bb)

Let's try to use `ROT47` this time.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/ca62a765-ecc8-47ad-af66-131841566466)

Notice there's the magic wand. Let's try to click on it. 

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/e7a3fc0b-e7bd-40d2-8351-aa70e4b739a3)

Still, we haven't got the decrypted string yet. Let's try to use `ROT13` this time. 

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/23c4a1b5-59bf-42a0-995b-5412b93ccc0e)

Finally, the string is decrypted.

### 4. `[Insane] `

Similar to the previous "insane" question, let's decode using `Base32` followed by `Base85`. 

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/3b1dba32-01d7-44d7-b31e-8409d6112b4f)

Again, let's paste it into the Base91 Decoder.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/2eafc4ef-5f7d-4d68-830d-544876f0e913)

Now, back to the CyberChef and we will see an important clue here.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/887137ea-d1a1-4d26-a716-eae9a364c67e)

Let's copy the output and paste it into CyberChef again leaving out the `(key: tangodown)` part.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/3b58b4ef-9995-4804-b2ea-7c8e96cdff67)

Now take the output and paste into the Vigenere Decoder with the key `tangodown`. 

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/21d5a491-6da9-4fde-bf11-11e08bba586d)

## Task 3: Base, Cipher, Bit Shift
Can you decode the combination? Maybe Hex workshop can help you out.

### `1. [Moderate] 2D 37 2B 19 31 99 31 B3 B2 AB A5 18 32 37 20 B3 B2 AC 2D 1A 31 B4 A1 3A A4 A3 9C B4 AD 36 AC 9E`

As the question suggests, we have to use the Hex workshop for this task. Copy the string and paste it into the Hex workshop. 
(Tip: Find `Paste Special` in the `Edit` menu, and then tick the `Interpret as a hexadecimal string`)

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/b46facd7-ad13-4cb5-91db-182491302680)

Now, according to the hint in the THM room, we have to perform logic shift. Hence, click on the `block shift left` once.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/edba30b0-3437-48cc-9a84-e8abc9dc78cb)

We can see from the decoded output on the right which hints that it is an encoded base. Hence, use CyberChef to decode it. 

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/440018d2-c029-4b98-bd22-61d492113ea3)

Finally, use `ROT13` to decrypt the string.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/a72ba101-f5bb-41df-8606-9deca158b8d5)

### `2. [Hard] 19 1A 1C 99 1C 9C A8 38 27 B2 34 27 B9 27 26 28 3C 3B AA 28 A5 AA 2A 29 3C 29 B2 B2 21 B1 AC A6 1C AC 29 A8 38 99 2C`

According to the THM hint, we have to perform an Arithmetic shift (8 bits). Hence, paste the string the same way as the previous question. Then, click on the rotate left and select 8 bits.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/c66a0634-37f5-4d65-ba81-66a101ad18cd)

Again, the output on the left seems like an encoded base. Copy it and paste it into CyberChef and see what we got.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/a510ee05-d205-4ecd-870d-3be93c1905f0)

Finally, use `ROT13` to finish decrypting it.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/3a18e647-1b0f-464a-977e-36402024215c)

### `3. [Insane] A9 A8 2B EE 2A AA C9 C8 C9 AA A8 0F 2A 8A AA EE A9 8A CA A8 A9 4F 6D 46 E9 A8 A8 0F A9 8A 6D 86 A9 AA A9 26 2A 8A 48 E8`

According to the THM hint, we will have to perform an Arithmetic shift (8 bits) first. Hence, click on the rotate left and select 8 bits like how we did in the previous question. This time, we have to rotate 3 times.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/a8318ad0-a954-43ee-81ea-e0db1da003c6)

The next step in the hint was base. Hence, use CyberChef to do the next step.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/6d952e57-6570-44dd-983b-8c12b908ac2a)

The output is a hexadecimal string. According to the hint, the next step is to perform a logical shift. Hence, use the Hex workshop to do the next step.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/88ca553c-bd18-4ce4-9cf1-475979121622)

The output is an encoded base. Hence, use CyberChef to decode it with `Base85`.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/22594a28-365e-44f7-b67f-331eacf23a49)

Finally, use `ROT13` to decrypt it.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/105c3ed7-5412-43bb-a5bc-e7ad70e648c5)
